answers.answer: It is good your doctor doesn't see any other cysts.   With diabetes and high blood pressure to deal with, it is no wonder you are feeling overwhelmed.   Once insulin resistance takes hold, it is common to gain in the belly.  Have you been diagnosed with PCOS?  Cutting carbs out completely and eating more protein may help reverse the stubborn insulin resistance and may help with the diabetes.  I say...don't listen to whoever is asking you if you are pregnant.  It is rude.  I know it can make you feel self-conscious, but stress makes both diabetes and high blood pressure worse.  I hope your cysts stay away and you begin to feel better soon!

question: i look prego and i hate it bc i am not i have looked this way for about year ppl are always asking are you prego the dr didnt see anymore ovarian cysts but i have had prombles with ovarian cysts for the past 3 years . I am on diabetes meds and high blood presure meds  that are doing no good !!!!!!!!! Can anyone help me !!!!!Pamela
title: i look prego
